name: Sukhasana
instructions: Sit cross-legged with your spine straight and hands resting on your knees. Close your eyes and focus on your breath, allowing your body to relax.
benefits: Calms the mind and nervous system
precautions: Use cushion or block if hips are tight
Avoid if knee or hip injury

name: Balasana
instructions: Kneel on the mat, sit back on your heels, and fold forward, resting your forehead on the mat with arms extended or by your sides. Breathe deeply and relax.
benefits: Releases tension in back, shoulders, and neck
precautions: Avoid if pregnant
Use pillow under forehead if uncomfortable

name: Vrikshasana
instructions: Stand tall, shift your weight onto one foot, and place the sole of your other foot on your inner thigh or calf. Bring your palms together at your chest and focus on a point ahead.
precautions: Never place foot on side of knee
Use wall support if needed

name: Marjaryasana
instructions: Start on your hands and knees. As you exhale, round your spine toward the ceiling, tucking your chin to your chest (Cat Pose).
precautions: Move slowly and gently
Avoid if wrist or knee problems

name: Bitilasana
instructions: From hands and knees, inhale and arch your back, lifting your head and tailbone toward the ceiling (Cow Pose). Alternate with Cat Pose for a gentle flow.
precautions: Don't overextend the neck
Move with breath

name: Adho Mukha Svanasana
instructions: From hands and knees, lift your hips up and back, straightening your legs and arms to form an inverted V shape. Press your heels toward the floor and relax your head.
precautions: Avoid if wrist or shoulder injury
Bend knees if hamstrings are tight

name: Bhujangasana
instructions: Lie on your stomach, place your hands under your shoulders, and gently lift your chest off the mat, keeping your elbows close to your body.
precautions: Don't overextend the back
Avoid if pregnant or with back injury

name: Supta Baddha Konasana
instructions: Lie on your back, bring the soles of your feet together, and let your knees fall open. Rest your arms by your sides and breathe deeply.
precautions: Support knees with bolsters if tight
Avoid if hip or groin injury

name: Viparita Karani
instructions: Lie on your back with your legs extended up a wall. Keep your arms relaxed by your sides and focus on your breath.
precautions: Avoid if glaucoma or neck issues
Use bolster under hips if needed

name: Savasana
instructions: Lie flat on your back with your legs and arms comfortably spread. Close your eyes, relax your entire body, and breathe naturally.
precautions: Use eye pillow if light sensitive
Place bolster under knees if back discomfort
